message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

I want to add formspree to form here. this is the action action="https://formspree.io/f/xjkaeeov"
  method="POST"

content.text: I'll help you add Formspree to your form. Let me first find the form in your codebase.

file.content:
Unilever Caivano, Italy

Unilever ice cream plant cuts energy use by 38% with fan retrofit

Download the White Paper

Explore the story

How we enabled Unilever’s Caivano factory to reduce energy use by 38% - paying back the investment in only 2 years.

“The Unilever sustainability target is to reduce greenhouse gasses by 100% on the 2015 baseline”.

Get the full story and documentation

Unilever’s Caivano production facility in Italy, is Unilever’s flagship site for industrial-scale ice-cream production, under the Algida and Magnum brands.

Based on detailed analysis and precise performance calculations, six outdated fans were replaced with six NOVENCO ZerAx axial flow fans (type AZL 900), each powered by a 15 kW Nidec permanent magnet (PM) motor.

Download the White Paper

Get in touch with us today!

Want to cut your energy consumption like Unilever Caivano did? Let’s discuss how we can help your business achieve similar results.

message.content:
I get this in network https://formspree.io/cdn-cgi/rum?
Request Method
POST
Status Code
204 No Content
Remote Address
172.66.40.119:443
Referrer Policy
strict-origin-when-cross-origin

content.text:
The 204 status code indicates the form is submitting to Formspree successfully, but you're seeing the Cloudflare RUM (Real User Monitoring) endpoint instead of your form data being processed.

This typically happens because the form needs to include `name` attributes that match what Formspree expects. Let me check the current form field names:

content.content:

file.content: >

content.text:
The form fields look correct. The 204 response you're seeing from `/cdn-cgi/rum` is actually Cloudflare's monitoring endpoint - it's not the actual form submission response.

Check your browser's Network tab for a POST request to `https://formspree.io/f/xjkaeeov` (not the CDN one). That's the actual form submission. A few things to verify:

1. **Email type**: Change the email input type from `text` to `email` for proper validation:

input.old_string:
<label for="r7c0m5r3f1">Email address*</label
                    ><input
                      id="r7c0m5r3f1"
                      name="email"
                      required=""
                      type="text"
                    />
input.new_string:
<label for="r7c0m5r3f1">Email address*</label
                    ><input
                      id="r7c0m5r3f1"
                      name="email"
                      required=""
                      type="email"
                    />

content.text:
Updated the email field to use `type="email"`. 

If you're still having issues, look for the actual POST request to `https://formspree.io/f/xjkaeeov` in your Network tab - that will show the real response. The form should work now, but you may need to verify your form in Formspree's dashboard if this is the first submission.
